info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 21 at 1:00AM CDT until July 21 at 3:00AM CDT by NWS Dodge City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN FORD...SOUTHWESTERN KIOWA...NORTHWESTERN COMANCHE AND CLARK COUNTIES... At 100 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Bucklin to 10 miles southeast of Clark State Lake to near Ashland to near Acres, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Sitka and Mullinville. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
